alert.note: Alert for Hill (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 6:50PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Montana... Big Sandy Creek at Havre affecting Hill County. For the Big Sandy Creek...including Havre...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sandy Creek at Havre. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, water overflows Road 50. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 PM MDT Wednesday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.2 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, April 21. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.9 feet on 06/06/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM MDT.
